alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 4:20AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS AND BLOWING SNOW FOR THE NORTHERN BRISTOL BAY COAST THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY MORNING... A developing low pressure system entering the eastern Bering Sea Thursday afternoon will produce strong winds and the potential for blowing snow for portions of the Bristol Bay region Thursday evening through late Friday morning. Southeasterly winds of 35 to 45 mph will develop Thursday evening as the low approaches the Southwest Coast, before becoming southerly Thursday night. The greatest potential for the strongest winds will occur early Friday morning west of Dillingham when gusts to 60 mph will be possible. While temperatures are expected to be in the mid-30s, which are typically less conducive for blowing snow, the strong winds may combine with the denser, wetter snowfall to produce hazardous, low visibility conditions at times. Winds will diminish late Friday morning as the low continues northward across the Yukon-Kuskokwim Delta.
